com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp

Class MvpNullObjectBasePresenter<V extends MvpView>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hannesdorfmann.mosby.mvp.MvpNullObjectBasePresenter<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - The type of the MvpView
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    MvpPresenter<V>

    public class MvpNullObjectBasePresenter<V extends MvpView>
extends java.lang.Object
implements MvpPresenter<V>
    A MvpPresenter implmenetation that implements the null object pattern for the attached mvp view. So whenever the view gets detached from this presenter by callingdetachView(boolean), a new "null object" view gets dynamically instantiated by using reflections and set as the current view (instead of null). The new "null object" view simply does nothing. This avoids null pointer exceptions and checks like if (getView() != null)
    Since:
    1.2.0
    See Also:
    MvpBasePresenter
